item.title: Auf den Terroranschlag folgt EU-Verschlüsselungsverbot - fm4.ORF.at
item.description: Im EU-Ministerrat wurde binnen fünf Tagen eine Resolution beschlussfertig gemacht, die Plattformbetreiber wie WhatsApp, Signal und Co künftig dazu verpflichtet, Generalschlüssel zur Überwachbarkeit von E2E-verschlüsselten Chats und Messages anzulegen.

item.title: Is this Mahler? This sounds like Mahler
item.description: One of the most delightful parts of being a software engineer and hardware tinkerer is having the ability to solve my own specific (and often niche) problems. In this post, the particular problem I’ll be solving is the burning need to know what is currently playing on WQXR, NYC’s classical radio station.

item.title: Blast Off with Blazor: Use .NET 5 to update the HTML head from a Blazor component

item.title: Taking screenshots isn't allowed by the app or your organization after upgrading to Android 11
item.description: Since updating to Android 11, I cannot take screenshots anymore. The screenshot is taken but then the notification appears stating that "Taking screenshots isn't allowed by the app or your organization."

item.title: Building the World's Weirdest Fan
item.description:
I'm in an experimental mood and thought I'd try building a modern bellows system! Will it work? Let's find out! Also, head to http://squarespace.com/diyperks to save 10% off your first purchase of a website or domain using offer code PERKS
I hope you guys enjoyed this crazy build! It's been a wild journey trying to get this video released - firstly with the delays caused by the ideas that didn't work, and then ultimately by a HARD DRIVE FAILURE! Literally ALL the footage in this video was lost, and it was only thanks to some great data recovery fellows that you're seeing this at all. Backup system implemented now, fyi ;) because of these delays, this is actually quite an old video now (like 1 year) but I'm glad it's able to see the light of day as I think the final result is SUPER COOL! In hind sight I may not have started this project of perseverance, but it taught me such a lot in terms of which projects to make to show you guys and how experimental I can  ultimately risk being. I know that basically none of you will make this, but the methodology ultimately settled upon is interesting and might have many more use cases. Either way it makes for interesting watching, so I hope you all enjoy it! ~Matt
item.author: (DIY Perks)
